critique: This executive order focuses on supporting tribal colleges and universities. It aims to strengthen the relationship between the federal government and these institutions, promote educational opportunities for Native American students, and preserve tribal languages and cultural traditions. The order establishes a board of advisors and a White House initiative to ensure accountability and coordination. It also encourages federal agencies to develop plans to increase the capacity of tribal colleges and to provide them with technical assistance. There is nothing here that restricts civil liberties, expands executive power, or promotes federal control over states. The order seems to promote social inclusion and moderate government intervention to support education.
